intro: Mahernia dregeana, commonly known as the Desert Dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, dandelion-like flowers. The plant is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Mahernia dregeana is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
